links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
example: It is a power of 2 iff n is a Fermat prime.
prog: (PARI) vector(40, n, eulerphi(2^n+1)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 12 2015(MAGMA) [EulerPhi(2^n+1) : n in [1..40]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 12 2015
